definition: to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat
to conceal from/to keep (sb) in the dark

sentences.english: Never lie, cheat or steal, always strike a fair deal.
sentences.chinese: 決不撒謊，欺瞞或偷盜，堅守平允買賣。

sentences.english: How have you handled customers who take advantage of sales support staff?
sentences.chinese: 你如何對待那些起欺瞞銷售輔助售人員的顧客？

sentences.english: Never lie,cheat or steal,always strike a fair deal.
sentences.chinese: 決不撒謊，欺瞞或偷盜，堅守公平交易。

sentences.english: never lie, cheat or steal, always strike a fair deal.
sentences.chinese: 決沒有說謊，欺瞞或偷竊，苦守平正生意業務。

sentences.english: He wish there are no more disputes in the earth, people should stop lieing, you don't know what that means.
sentences.chinese: 他希望這個地球不再紛爭，人們不再欺瞞，你不相信。

sentences.english: It is a shame then that ignorance and conceit should be stronger than wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 那麼無知和欺瞞竟然壓倒智慧就是一種羞愧。

sentences.english: He wish there are no more disputes in the earth, people should stop lieing, you don't know what that.
sentences.chinese: 他希望這個地球不再紛爭，人們不再欺瞞，你不信。

sentences.english: Because it is for want of this logical articulation that these slippages can be produced.
sentences.chinese: 因爲缺乏這個邏輯的表達，纔會產生這些欺瞞詭辯。

definition: to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
